title.narrative: Cambodia Programme for Country Partnership (PCP): Towards a sustainable, skill-based and export-oriented economy

description.narrative: The Programme for Country Partnership (PCP) for Cambodia, will support the Royal Government of Cambodia (RGC) in the implementation of its national Industrial Development Policy (IDP) and more general in the implementation of its national strategy for inclusive and sustainable growth and sustainable development (Agenda 2030) with the dimensions of social, economic and environmental sustainability. Under the leadership of the Ministry of Industry, Science, technology and Innovation (MISTI) (MEF), being in charge of the coordination of the implementation of the IDP, the PCP will be operationalized in several phases and it is structured along two main components: # Agro Value Chain Development, including linkages to the tourism sector; # Industrial Diversification, Innovation and development of Special Economic Zones (SEZs). The two main components will be supported through five crosscutting components, namely: industrial policy and statistics, quality in frastructure, sustainable energy, circular economy, and women#s empowerment and youth employment. The PCP through its interventions will support Cambodia#s IDP implementation and foster ISID. The PCP is based on the RGC#s vision to transform and modernize Cambodia#s industrial structure from a labour intensive to a skill-driven industry by 2025, and its object
